troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV not powering on with indicator light off

steps.description: Check if SD2 12V is working properly
Check if fuse PF1 is damaged
Check if the primary circuit components have short circuits
Replace any damaged components
Check EMI components PLF1/PLF2 and bridge rectifiers PD1/PD2/PD6 for damage
Replace any damaged components
Check if PE1 voltage is 380V
Check if PU2 voltage is normal
Check if resistors PR8/PR9 are normal
Replace resistors if damaged
Check if MOS PQ1 is functional
Replace MOS PQ1 if damaged
Check if transformer PIN10 has output
Replace transformer PT1 if necessary
Check rectifier diode SD2
Replace SD2 if necessary
Check if main board has short circuit

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with no backlight but powered on

steps.description: Check if the plug is correctly connected and compatible with the light strip
Correct the plug connection or replace with matching light strip
Check if LED+ voltage is normal at JS1/JS2
Check if step-down MOS SQ1 has short circuit
Replace MOS SQ1 if damaged
Check if backlight IC SU2 is damaged
Replace IC SU2 if damaged
Check if BK_ADJ and VBL_CTR status signals are correct
Check if main board control circuit is normal
Upgrade software if necessary
Check if boost inductor voltage is normal
Check if transformer output is normal
Replace transformer if necessary

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with indicator light on but not starting up

steps.description: Check if all voltages after 12V in the power distribution tree are normal
Replace chips corresponding to circuits with no voltage output
Use serial port tool to check for print messages during power up
Check if crystal oscillation is normal
Try rewelding the chip using hot air gun
Replace main chip U10 if necessary
Check if reset circuit is normal
Replace reset IC if necessary
Check if reset PIN W14 voltage is 3.3V
Repair corresponding circuit if needed
Check if EMMC and circuit connections are normal
Check if IR and keypad related circuits are normal
Replace EMMC IC U23 if needed
Upgrade software

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with abnormal screen display

steps.description: Check if panel cable is correctly connected, not damaged, and not loose
Replace panel cable and connect correctly if needed
Check if panel voltage is correct
Verify 12V voltage is present
Check if MOS Q12 is damaged
Replace MOS Q12 if damaged
Check if panel voltage control signal is high
Check if main chip control signal pins are damaged
Upgrade software if necessary
Remove LVDS cable and check if impedance of each signal to ground is abnormal
Use hot air gun to reweld chip
Replace main chip if needed

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV unable to find channels

steps.description: Check if ATV/DTV channel search function is normal
Check if Q4 voltage is 3.3V and crystal clock is correct
Replace YT2 if necessary
Check if IIC communication is normal during channel searching
Repair IIC related circuit if needed
Check if IF and IQ signals are normal
Check if main chip IF-/IF+/IQ pins are damaged
Check if AGC is functioning properly
Upgrade software if necessary
Replace main chip U10 if needed
Replace tuner IC UT3 if needed

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with no sound

steps.description: Check if power amplifier supply AL1 is normal
Repair relevant circuits if needed
Check if audio input is present at amplifier chip
Check if LC filter in power amplifier output circuit is damaged
Replace corresponding components if needed
Check if amplifier chip is damaged
Replace amplifier chip U27 if needed
Check if amplifier chip FAULT signal is high
Check if mute circuit is working properly
Check if IO control is normal and mute control signal is low
Upgrade software if necessary
Replace main chip U10 if needed
Repair components related to MUTE circuit
Check if main chip CLK and Data outputs are present
Check if corresponding source signals are being input to main chip pins
Repair circuit between signal input interface and chip pins

troubleshooting_issues.issue: General maintenance precautions for TV repair

steps.description: Before maintenance, confirm the large electrolytic capacitors have been discharged to avoid electric shock
Implement electrostatic protection measures, especially when working with sensitive components like chips, MOSFETs, and crystal oscillators
For SMD chip replacement, use a heat gun set to approximately 340 degrees
When using soldering iron, confirm it doesn't have electrical leakage
Keep soldering time for each joint as short as possible
Be careful around high voltage conversion circuits
Follow proper static discharge procedures to prevent secondary damage to the driver board

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with indicator light on but won't power on

steps.description: Check all voltages after 12V on the power distribution tree. If any are abnormal, replace the chip corresponding to the voltage-free output circuit.
Use a serial port tool to check for print messages during power-on.
Check if the crystal oscillator is working normally.
Use a hot air gun to resolder the chip. If resoldering doesn't work, replace the main chip U10.
Check if the reset circuit is working normally. If not, repair the corresponding circuit.
Check if EMMC and circuit connections are normal.
Check IR and KEYPAD related circuits. If IR/KEYPAD circuits are abnormal, upgrade the software. If that doesn't work, replace EMMC IC U23.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot abnormal screen display issues

steps.description: Check if the panel cable is correctly connected, not damaged, and not loose. If issues found, replace the panel cable and connect correctly.
Check if panel voltage is correct.
Check for 12V voltage. If 12V is present, check if MOS U28 is damaged. If yes, replace it.
Check if panel voltage control signal is high.
Check if main chip control signal pins are damaged. If main chip pins are damaged, upgrade the software.
Remove LVDS cable and check if signal-to-ground impedance is abnormal.
Use hot air gun to resolder the chip. If resoldering doesn't fix the issue, replace the main chip.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that cannot find channels

steps.description: Check if ATV channel search works normally.
Check if UT1 voltage supply is normal.
Check if IIC communication is normal during channel search. If not, repair IIC-related circuits.
Check if IF & IQ signals are normal.
Check if main chip IF-/IF+/IQ are damaged. Check if AGC circuit is working. If not, upgrade the software.
If software upgrade doesn't work, replace the main chip U10.
If all above steps don't resolve the issue, replace Tuner UT1.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with no sound

steps.description: Check if amplifier power supply AL1 is normal. If not, repair the corresponding circuit.
Check if audio input is present at the amplifier chip.
Check if LC filter in power amplifier output circuit is damaged. If LC filter is damaged, replace the corresponding components.
Check if the amplifier chip is damaged. If yes, replace amplifier chip U27.
Check if power amplifier chip FAULT signal is high.
Check if mute circuit is working correctly. Check if IO control is normal and mute control is low. If not, upgrade the software.
If software upgrade doesn't work, replace the main chip U10.
Check if main chip CLK and Data outputs are present.
Check if source signals are reaching the main chip pins. If source signals aren't reaching main chip, repair the circuit between signal input interface and chip pins.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that has no audio signal from HDMI source

steps.description: Check if the HDMI cable is properly connected to both the TV and source device.
Verify if audio is working through other sources (like AV or internal tuner).
Check the mute status using pin AR8.
Check if RTD2851A pins AB6 and AC4 are receiving audio input.
Verify if the amplifier U27 is receiving the I2S signal.
Check if pin 1 on amplifier U27 (mute control) is working properly.
Check the connection between HDMI ports and main chip U10.
If all connections are good, try upgrading the software.
If issue persists, replace the main chip U10.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with signal processing issues on HDMI ports

steps.description: Check all HDMI ports for physical damage and proper connection.
Check if the RTD2851A main chip is receiving power at all required voltage points.
Verify crystal oscillator YT2 is functioning correctly.
Check if IIC communication is working between the main chip and HDMI receiver circuit.
Test with different HDMI cables and source devices to isolate the issue.
Check if the main chip's HDMI processing pins are damaged.
If all physical connections are good, upgrade the software.
If issue persists, use a hot air gun to resolder the main chip.
If all else fails, replace the main chip U10.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that has a black screen with backlight on

steps.description: Check if the backlight voltage is OK.
Check if LCD power VCC-Panel is OK and if CN5 voltage is OK.
Check if QML1 output voltage is OK. If no, repair the circuit.
Change the LCD and check if it resolves the issue.
Check U16(RTD2864) power supply and clock circuit chip LVBS output pin for short circuit or open-circuit conditions.
Check if the software is compatible. If not, re-update the software.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with no sound

steps.description: Check if there is any audio signal input and if amplifier power supply is normal. If no, check external audio equipment and amplifier power supply circuit.
Check if UA1(WA15-6819B) Pin7 & Pin8 IIC communication is working. If not, check peripheral circuits.
Check the Volume and MUTE settings. If incorrect, reset them.
Check if CN11 has signal output.
Check U16 for audio signal output. If U16 has no signal output, maintain U16 peripheral circuits. If yes, check U16 & UA1 connection network.
If UA1 peripheral circuits are not working, repair them. If external speaker is faulty, replace it.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that cannot search for channels

steps.description: Check if external RF signal input is present. If no, check external RF equipment.
Check if UT1 has 3.3V power. If no, check the power circuit.
Check if Tuner pin has I2C data. If no, check if pull-up voltage of I2C network is normal.
Check if Tuner pin has IF signal.
Check if external Tuner is OK. If Tuner is OK, repair its outer circuit. If not, change the Tuner.
Check Tuner and U16 connection network.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot HDMI issues with no image

steps.description: Check the connection network between HDMI and the input network.
Check HDMI signal HPD & I2C communication.
If HDMI connection is faulty, repair it.
If sound is not working in PC mode, follow the 'No Sound Solution' troubleshooting guide.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV power issues using the power chart

steps.description: In stand-by condition, check if DC 12V is OK.
Check if main board U3D1 has 3.3V, U1D4 has 1.0V, and U1D1 has 1.5V.
If voltages are not present, check the power board.
After power on, check if point U1D5 has 1.0V, U1D2 has 1.5V, and U1D3 has 1.8V.
If any voltage is missing, check the availability of short-circuit power supply and motherboard.
If all voltages are present, proceed with normal boot.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot power issues (Mainboard cannot boot)

steps.description: Check if DC 12V is OK in stand-by condition.
Check if mainboard U3D1 has 3.3V, U1D4 has 1.0V, and U1D1 has 1.5V.
After power on, check if point U1D5 & U1D6 have 1.0V, U1D2 has 1.5V, and U1D3 has 1.8V.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot display unit (black screen or flickering)

steps.description: Check if the backlight voltage is OK.
Check if LCD power VCC-Panel is OK and if CN5 voltage is OK and QML1 output voltage is OK.
Check if U16 (RTD2874) power supply and clock circuit chip V-BY-1 output pin is short circuit or open-circuit. If issues found, repair accordingly.
Check if the software is matchable. If yes, change the LCD and check if it resolves the issue. If no, re-update the software.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot audio unit (no sound)

steps.description: Check if any audio signal input or amplifier power supply is normal. If no, check external audio equipment and amplifier power supply circuit.
Check the Volume and MUTE settings. If incorrect, reset them.
Check if CN11 has signal output. If yes, check external speaker.
Check if U16 has audio signal output. If no, maintain U16 peripheral circuits.
Check UA1 (WA15-6819B) Pin7 & Pin8 IIC. If issue found, check U16 & UA1 connect part network. If no issue, check UA1 peripheral circuits.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV function (TV no searching/no image)

steps.description: Check if external RF signal input is present. If no, check external RF equipment.
Check if the UT1 has 3.3V. If no, check the power circuit.
Check if the Tuner has 3.3V. If no, check circuit of UT1.
Check if Tuner pin has I2C data. If no, check pull-up voltage of I2C network is normal.
Check if Tuner pin has IF signal. If no, check external Tuner is OK.
Check Tuner and U16 connect network. If issues found, repair accordingly. If no issues, change Tuner.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot HDMI function (No image or Image with no sound)

steps.description: For No Image: Check the connect network.
For No Image: Check HDMI and the input network.
For No Image: Check HDMI signal HPD & I2C. If issues found, repair accordingly. If no issues, check HDMI connection.
For Image but No Sound: Check if the sound is OK in PC.
For Image but No Sound (Sound OK in PC): Check HDMI and input network.
For Image but No Sound (Sound NOT OK in PC): See the repairs guide "No Sound Solution."

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that has power unit problems (mainboard cannot boot)

steps.description: Check if device is in stand-by condition.
Check if DC 5V_STB is OK.
If DC 5V_STB is OK, check main board voltages: U3D1 has 3.3V, U1D4 has 1.0V, U1D1 has 1.5V.
If all standby voltages are correct, check voltages after power on: U1D5 & U1D6 have 1.0V, U1D2 has 1.5V, U1D3 has 1.8V.
If all voltages are correct, device should boot normally.
If any voltages are incorrect after power on, check for short-circuit in power supply and motherboard.
If initial voltages are incorrect, check components U3D1, U1D4, U1D1 and fix or replace as needed.
If DC 5V_STB is not OK, check the power board and fix or replace as needed.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with display unit issues (black screen)

steps.description: Identify if the display issue is a black screen or flickering with backlight on.
Check backlight voltage.
If backlight voltage is OK, try replacing the LCD panel.
If new LCD works, problem is solved.
If new LCD doesn't work, check software compatibility.
If software is compatible, check U16 (RTD2874) power supply, clock circuit, and V-BY-1 output pin for short/open circuit. Fix any identified issues.
If software is incompatible, re-update software and check voltages: VCC-Panel, CNS voltage, QM-1 output voltage. Fix any voltage issues.
If backlight voltage is not OK, check backlight components and fix or replace as needed.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with audio unit issues (no sound)

steps.description: Identify no sound condition.
Check audio signal input and amplifier power supply.
If input/power not normal, check external audio equipment and amplifier power supply. Fix power circuit issues.
If input/power normal, check Volume MUTE settings.
If MUTE is active, adjust volume/mute settings.
If MUTE not active, check CN11 signal output.
If no signal at CN11, check external speaker and replace if faulty.
If signal present at CN11, check UA1 (WA15-6819B) Pin7 & Pin8 IC.
If UA1 pins abnormal, check UA1 peripheral circuits and fix/replace components.
If UA1 pins normal, check U16 audio signal output.
If no output from U16, maintain U16 peripheral circuits and fix/replace components.
If output present from U16, check U16 & UA1 connection network and fix connection issues.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with function unit issues (TV broke down, no searching/no image)

steps.description: Identify TV issue (no searching/no image).
Check external RF signal input.
If no RF signal, check power circuit.
If power circuit faulty, repair power circuit.
If power OK but no RF signal, check if U1 has 3.3V.
If U1 has 3.3V, replace Tuner.
If U1 doesn't have 3.3V, check/repair U1 circuit.
If RF signal present, check if Tuner has 3.3V.
If Tuner has no 3.3V, check Tuner-U16 connection network and repair connections.
If Tuner has 3.3V, check Tuner pins for I2C data.
If no I2C data, check I2C pull-up voltage and repair if abnormal.
If I2C data present, check Tuner pins for IF signal.
If no IF signal, check external Tuner.
If external Tuner OK, replace main Tuner.
If external Tuner faulty, repair external Tuner circuit.
If IF signal present, replace Tuner.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with HDMI function unit issues

steps.description: Identify HDMI issue: A. No image, B. Image but no sound.
If issue is 'No image', check HDMI connection.
If connection is good, check HDMI signal (HPD & I2C).
If signals are present, check connection network and repair connections.
If signals are missing, check HDMI input network and repair connections.
If connection is bad, fix HDMI connection.
If issue is 'Image but no sound', check sound in PC.
If sound is OK in PC, check HDMI input network and repair connections.
If no sound in PC, consult 'No Sound Solution' guide.
For other issues, check HDMI connection and repair as needed.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with 12V Output Problem

steps.description: Check if power indicator light is on.
Check if SD1 12V is normal.
Check if fuse PF1 is damaged.
Check whether other devices in the primary section are short-circuit damaged.
Replace damaged components.
Check whether EMI device PLF2 bridge PD1 is damaged.
Check if PE2 voltage is 1.414*AC input voltage.
Check whether the PU2 VCC voltage is ok.
Check whether resistors are turned on and resistors PR11, PR12 are ok.
Check whether the transformer PT1 outputs.
Check rectifier diode SD1.
Check the motherboard part for short circuit.
Replace diode SD1.
Replace the transformer PT1.
Replace the resistor.
Check whether primary MOS PQ2 is ok. If ok, check whether the transformer PT1 outputs. If not ok, replace MOS.
Check whether primary MOS PQ2 is ok and PU2 VCC voltage is ok. (Combined from source logic)

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Backlight Problem

steps.description: Check if the normal boot backlight does not light.
Check whether the plug is correct and whether it matches the light bar.
Check whether the LED+ voltage is normal (JS1/JS2).
Check whether the buck MOS SQ1 is shorted.
Check whether the backlight IC SU2 is damaged.
Check if SD7 is normal.
Check whether the main board control circuit is normal.
Check that BRI_ADJ and VBL_CTRL state is correct.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Indicator Light but No Power On

steps.description: Identify indicator light, no power on problem.
Follow the power distribution tree to check that all voltages after 12V are OK.
Use the serial port tool to check whether there is printing information when powered on.
Check if the reset circuit is normal.
Check whether the EMMC and circuit connections are normal.
Check if IR, KEYPAD related circuits are normal.
Reprogram the program.
Replace EMMC IC U20.
Repair the corresponding circuit Q201.
Check if the crystal oscillator is normal.
Check if it's ok for the chip to be re-soldered with a heat gun.
Replace the chip U12, U20.
Replace chip U12, U20.
Replace the chip corresponding to the no-voltage output circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Abnormal Screen Display

steps.description: Identify abnormal screen display.
Confirm whether the screen cable is plugged in correctly and whether it's damaged or loose.
Replace the screen cable with a new one and connect it correctly.
Check if there is 12V voltage.
Check the main chip control signal pin.
Heat gun to re-solder the chip.
Replace the main chip U12.
Reprogram the program.
Remove the LVDS cable and check if the impedance of each signal to ground is abnormal.
Check if MOS Q14 is damaged.
Replace MOS Q14.
Check if R165 screen voltage control signal is high.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that Can't Find the Station

steps.description: Identify TV can't find the station problem.
Check if the ATV search is normal.
Check whether RT5, RT6 IIC communicates normally when searching for stations.
Check to see if IF&IQ is normal.
Check if AGC RT11 has action.
Replace the Tuner UT1.
Reprogram the program.
Check if the main chip IF/IF+/IQ is damaged.
Replace the main chip U12.
Repair IIC-related circuits.
Check if UT1 voltage (power supply) is normal.
Detect 3V3 power supply system.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with No Sound

steps.description: Identify no sound problem.
Check whether the power amplifier power supply AL1 is normal.
Check if the amplifier chip has audio input.
Check whether the power amplifier chip FAULT is high.
Check AQ1 if the mute circuit is working properly.
Check if the IO control is normal or not.
Reprogram the program.
Repair MUTE circuit-related devices.
Check whether the LC filter in the power amplifier output circuit is damaged.
Replace the corresponding device.
Check whether the power amplifier chip U27 is damaged.
Replace the power amplifier chip.
Check whether the main chip CLK and Date have output.
Check whether the corresponding source signal is input to the main chip pin.
Replace the main chip.
Repair the circuit between the signal input interface and the chip pins.
Repair the corresponding circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with 12V Output Problem

steps.description: Check if the power indicator light is on.
Check if SD1 12V is normal.
Check if fuse PF1 is damaged.
Check whether other devices in the primary section are short-circuit damaged.
Replace damaged components.
Check whether EMI device PLF1 bridge PD1 is damaged.
Check if PE2 voltage is 310V.
Check whether PU2 turn-on voltage is ok.
Check whether the resistors are turned on and PR10, PR12 are ok.
Check whether the transformer PT1 outputs.
Check rectifier diode SD1. If ok, check the motherboard part for a short circuit. If not ok, replace diode SD1.
Replace the transformer PT1.
Replace the resistor.
Check whether primary MOS PQ1 is ok. If ok, check whether the transformer PT1 outputs. If not ok, replace MOS.
Repair power circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Backlight Problem

steps.description: Check if the normal boot backlight does not light.
Check whether the plug is correct and whether it matches the light bar.
Check whether the LED+ voltage is normal at JS1/JS2.
Check if the backlight IC SU2 is damaged.
Check if the transformer output is normal.
Check if SD7 is normal.
Check that BRI_ADJ and VBL_CTRL state is correct.
Check whether the main board control circuit is normal.
Reprogram the software. Check if the voltage of the step-down inductor is normal.
Check if the buck MOS SQ1 is shorted.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Indicator Light but No Power On

steps.description: Identify indicator light, no power-on problem.
Follow the power distribution tree to check that all voltages after 12V are OK.
Use the serial port tool to check whether there is printing information when powered on.
Check if the reset circuit is normal.
Check whether the EMMC and circuit connections are normal.
Check if IR, KEYPAD related circuits are normal. If normal, reprogram the program.
Replace EMMC IC U20.
Repair the corresponding circuit R31.
Check if the crystal oscillator is normal.
Is it ok for the chip to be re-soldered with a heat gun?
Replace the chip.
Replace the chip corresponding to the no-voltage output circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with Abnormal Screen Display

steps.description: Identify abnormal screen display.
Check screen cable connection and damage. If cable faulty/loose, replace cable and reconnect.
Check for 12V voltage.
Inspect main chip control signal pin.
Re-solder chip with heat gun. If unsuccessful, replace main chip.
Reprogram software.
Remove LVDS cable and check signal-ground impedance.
Check MOS Q16. If Q16 damaged, replace Q16.
Verify screen voltage control signal is high.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV that Can't Find the Station

steps.description: Identify TV can't find the station problem.
Check if ATV search is normal.
Check whether the IIC communicates normally when searching for stations.
Repair IIC related circuits.
Check if UT1 voltage power supply is normal.
Check to see if IF3Q is normal.
Detect 3V3 power supply system.
Check if the main IF/IF+/FQ is damaged.
Replace the main chip U12.
Check if AGC has action.
Reprogram the program.
Replace the Tuner UT1.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot a TV with No Sound

steps.description: Identify no sound problem.
Check ALI power supply.
Check amplifier chip audio input.
Check LC filter in output circuit. If damaged, replace damaged components.
Check power amplifier chip. If damaged, replace amplifier chip.
Check FAULT pin status.
Check mute circuit.
Verify mute control signal. If abnormal, reprogram the program.
Repair mute circuit components, then reprogram the program.
Check main chip CLK/Date output.
Check source signal to main chip. If signal present, replace main chip. If no signal, repair input interface circuit.
Repair ALI circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with no power (indicator light not on)

steps.description: Check if fuse PF1 is damaged.
Check if EMI devices PLF2, PLF3, and bridge stack PD4 are damaged.
Check if PE1 voltage is 380V.
Check if PU4 turn-on voltage is OK. If no, check if resistance opening resistors PR59/PR64 are OK. If they're not OK, replace the resistors.
Check if primary MOS PQ4 is OK.
Check if transformer PIN3 outputs.
Check rectifier diode SD4. If not OK, replace diode SD4. If OK, check whether other devices in the primary section are short-circuit damaged and replace if necessary.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV backlight not working (with normal boot)

steps.description: Check if the plug is correct and matches the light bar.
Check if BK_ADJ and VBL_CTR status is correct.
Check if the main board control circuit is normal.
Check if diodes SD1/SD2 are damaged.
Check if LED+ voltage is normal at JS1/JS2. If no, check if backlight IC SU1 is damaged.
Check if transformer output is normal. If no, replace the transformer.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV that powers on (indicator light on) but doesn't boot

steps.description: Follow the power distribution tree to check that all voltages after 12V are OK.
Use the serial port tool to check whether there is printing information when powered on.
Check if the crystal oscillator is normal.
Try re-soldering the chip with a heat gun.
Check if the reset circuit is normal.
Check if IR, KEYPAD related circuits are normal. If normal, reprogram the program. If not normal, repair the corresponding circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot abnormal screen display

steps.description: Confirm whether the screen cable is plugged in correctly, and whether the screen cable is damaged or loose.
Check whether the EMMC and circuit connections are normal.
Check whether the screen voltage is correct. If not correct, check if there is 12V voltage.
Check if MOS U16 is damaged and replace if necessary.
Check if the screen voltage control signal is high.
Check if the main chip control signal pin is damaged. If damaged, reprogram the program.
Remove the LVDS cable and check whether the impedance of each signal to ground is abnormal. If abnormal, use heat gun to re-solder the chip. If that doesn't work, replace the main chip.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV that can't find stations

steps.description: Check if ATV station search is normal.
Check if UT1 voltage and power supply is normal. If not normal, detect 3V3 power supply system and repair as needed.
Check if IIC communication is normal when searching for stations. If not normal, repair IIC related circuits.

Check if IF&IQ is normal. If not normal, check if AGC has action. If AGC doesn't have action, check if the main chip IF-/IF+/IQ is damaged and replace main chip U26 if damaged. If AGC has action, replace Tuner UT1.
If ATV search is normal but DTV isn't, reprogram the program.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with no sound

steps.description: Check whether the power amplifier power supply AL1 is normal.
Check if the power amplifier chip has audio input.
Check whether the main chip CLK and Date have output.

Check whether the corresponding source signal is input to the main chip pin. If not, repair the circuit between the signal input interface and the chip pins. If the source signal is properly input, replace the main chip.
If power amplifier chip has audio input, check if the LC filter in the power amplifier output circuit is damaged.
Check whether the power amplifier chip is damaged.
Check whether the power amplifier chip FAULT is high.

Check if the mute circuit is working properly. If not working properly, check if the IO control is normal and if the mute control is low. If not normal, reprogram the program. If normal, replace the main chip.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Precautions for TV board maintenance

steps.description: The EL.RT2874-FG95 is a ultra-HD LCD driver board that integrates power conversion, backlight driving and signal processing.
Ensure static electricity protection during maintenance, especially for sensitive components like chips, MOS, and crystal oscillators.
Take precautions to prevent secondary damage to the driver board during maintenance.
For chip replacement, use a hot air gun with temperature set around 340 degrees.
When using a soldering iron, verify it's not leaking electricity, set temperature at 340-360 degrees, and avoid soldering for too long.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV that powers on (indicator light on) but doesn't boot

steps.description: Check whether all voltages after 12V are normal according to the power distribution tree.
Use serial port tools to check if there is printing information when powered on.
Check whether the crystal oscillator is normal.
Check whether the chip is soldered again with a Heat gun.
Check whether the reset circuit is normal.
Check whether IR and KEYPAD related circuits are normal. If normal, reburning program. If not normal, repair the corresponding circuit.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot abnormal screen display

steps.description: Confirm whether the screen cable is inserted correctly and whether the screen cable is damaged or loose.
Check whether EMMC and circuit connection are normal.
Check if the screen voltage is correct.
Check if the 12V voltage is present. If no 12V voltage, check if MOS U16 is damaged and replace if necessary.
Check if the screen voltage control signal is high.
Check if the control signal pin of the main chip is damaged. If damaged, reburning program.
Remove the LVDS cable and check if the impedance of each signal to ground is abnormal. If abnormal, re-weld the chip with Heat gun. If that doesn't work, replace the main chip.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV that can't find stations

steps.description: Check whether ATV channel search is normal.
Check whether UT1 voltage supply is normal. If not normal, testing the 3V3 power supply system and repair as needed.
Check if IIC communication is normal during channel search. If not normal, repair IIC related circuits.

Check if IF&IQ is normal. If not normal, check if the AGC is operating. If AGC isn't operating, check if the main chip IF-/IF+/IQ is damaged and replace main chip U7 if damaged. If AGC is operating, replace Tuner UT1.
If ATV search is normal but DTV isn't, reburning program.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Troubleshoot TV with no sound

steps.description: Check whether power supply AL1 of power amplifier is normal.
Check if the power amplifier chip has audio input.
Check if the main chip CLK and Date have outputs.

Check if the corresponding source signal is input to the main chip pin. If not, repair the circuit between the signal input interface and the chip pins. If the source signal is properly input, replace the main chip.
If power amplifier chip has audio input, check if the LC filter in the power amplifier output circuit is damaged.
Check if the power amplifier chip is damaged.
Check if the power amplifier chip has a high fault.

Check if the mute circuit is working properly. If not working properly, check whether the IO control is normal and whether the mute control is low. If not normal, reburning program. If normal, replace the main chip.

troubleshooting_issues.issue: Precautions for TV board maintenance

steps.description: The LT-2874WV6.2 is a fully high-definition LCD driver board that integrates backlight driving and signal processing.
Take electrostatic protection during maintenance, especially for circuits directly connected to sensitive devices such as chips, MOS, and crystal oscillators.
Prevent secondary damage to the driver board during maintenance.
For chip mounting type, it is recommended to use a Heat gun for maintenance and replacement, with temperature set at about 340 °C.
When using soldering iron, confirm if there is any leakage, set the temperature at around 340-360, and do not weld for too long.
